detaileddescription.para: FIXME: This should be in thread-local storage.

briefdescription.para: Control behaviour of the program when allocation fails.

detaileddescription.para: Although your program is probably toast when memory allocation fails, it is also probably a good idea to be able to catch these errors and alert the user in some way. Either that, or you might want the program to call abort() so that you can debug the failed code. This function allows you to control that behaviour.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to a jmp_buf initialized with setjmp(), or NULL to remove a previously set jump target.
If non-zero, the program will call abort() when allocation fails rather than exiting or calling longjmp().

simplesect.para: Pointer to a previously set jmp_buf, if any.

briefdescription.para: Fail (with a message) according to behaviour specified by ckd_set_jump().

memberdef.argsstring: (size_t n_elem, size_t elem_size, const char *caller_file, int caller_line)
memberdef.name: __ckd_calloc__

memberdef.argsstring: (void *ptr, size_t new_size, const char *caller_file, int caller_line)
memberdef.name: __ckd_realloc__

briefdescription.para: Like strdup, except that if an error occurs it prints a diagnostic message and exits.

detaileddescription.para: If origin in NULL the function also returns NULL.

memberdef.argsstring: (size_t d1, size_t d2, size_t elemsize, const char *caller_file, int caller_line)
memberdef.name: __ckd_calloc_2d__

briefdescription.para: Allocate a 2-D array and return ptr to it (ie, ptr to vector of ptrs).

detaileddescription.para: The data area is allocated in one block so it can also be treated as a 1-D array.

briefdescription.para: Free a 2-D array (ptr) previously allocated by ckd_calloc_2d.

memberdef.argsstring: (size_t d1, size_t d2, size_t d3, size_t elemsize, const char *caller_file, int caller_line)
memberdef.name: __ckd_calloc_3d__

briefdescription.para: Allocate a 3-D array and return ptr to it.

detaileddescription.para: The data area is allocated in one block so it can also be treated as a 1-D array.

briefdescription.para: Free a 3-D array (ptr) previously allocated by ckd_calloc_3d.

memberdef.argsstring: (size_t d1, size_t d2, size_t d3, size_t d4, size_t elem_size, char *file, int line)
memberdef.name: __ckd_calloc_4d__

briefdescription.para: Allocate a 34D array and return ptr to it.

detaileddescription.para: The data area is allocated in one block so it can also be treated as a 1-D array.

briefdescription.para: Free a 4-D array (ptr) previously allocated by ckd_calloc_4d.

memberdef.argsstring: (size_t d1, size_t d2, size_t d3, void *store, size_t elem_size, char *file, int line)
memberdef.name: __ckd_alloc_3d_ptr

briefdescription.para: Overlay a 3-D array over a previously allocated storage area.

memberdef.argsstring: (size_t d1, size_t d2, void *store, size_t elem_size, char *file, int line)
memberdef.name: __ckd_alloc_2d_ptr

briefdescription.para: Overlay a s-D array over a previously allocated storage area.
